title: Hyundai, Kia Recall Almost 500,000 Vehicles Because of Fire Risk
sub_head: The auto makers are telling owners to park outside and away from buildings and other cars
body:
Hyundai Motor Co. and Kia Corp. are asking the owners of nearly 500,000 vehicles in the U.S. to park outside because of malfunctions causing engine compartments to catch on fire.
The auto makers have recalled the vehicles, warning that malfunctions in their anti-lock brake systems could cause an electrical short, increasing the risk of a fire when driving a car or when it is parked, according to filings with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.
